Detailed Description

Support functions for managing the MII management port.

Revision
99583

cvmx_mgmt_port_result_t cvmx_mgmt_port_initialize ( int  port  ) 

Called to initialize a management port for use.

Multiple calls to this function accross applications is safe.

Parameters:
port Port to initialize
Returns:
CVMX_MGMT_PORT_SUCCESS or an error code

Multiple calls to this function across applications is safe.

Parameters:
port Port to initialize
Returns:
CVMX_MGMT_PORT_SUCCESS or an error code
cvmx_helper_link_info_t cvmx_mgmt_port_link_get ( int  port  ) 

Return the link state of an RGMII/MII port as returned by auto negotiation.

The result of this function may not match Octeon's link config if auto negotiation has changed since the last call to __cvmx_mgmt_port_link_set().

Parameters:
port The RGMII/MII interface port to query
Returns:
Link state

The result of this function may not match Octeon's link config if auto negotiation has changed since the last call to cvmx_mgmt_port_link_set().

Parameters:
port The RGMII/MII interface port to query
Returns:
Link state
int cvmx_mgmt_port_link_set ( int  port,
cvmx_helper_link_info_t  link_info 
)

Configure RGMII/MII port for the specified link state.

This function does not influence auto negotiation at the PHY level.

Parameters:
port RGMII/MII interface port
link_info The new link state
Returns:
Zero on success, negative on failure
int cvmx_mgmt_port_receive ( int  port,
int  buffer_len,
void *  buffer 
)

Receive a packet from the management port.

Parameters:
port Management port
buffer_len Size of the buffer to receive the packet into
buffer Buffer to receive the packet into
Returns:
The size of the packet, or a negative erorr code on failure. Zero means that no packets were available.
cvmx_mgmt_port_result_t cvmx_mgmt_port_send ( int  port,
int  packet_len,
void *  buffer 
)

Send a packet out the management port.

The packet is copied so the input buffer isn't used after this call.

Parameters:
port Management port
packet_len Length of the packet to send. It does not include the final CRC
buffer Packet data
Returns:
CVMX_MGMT_PORT_SUCCESS or an error code
cvmx_mgmt_port_result_t cvmx_mgmt_port_set_mac ( int  port,
uint64_t  mac 
)

Set the MAC address for a management port.

Parameters:
port Management port
mac New MAC address. The lower 6 bytes are used.
Returns:
CVMX_MGMT_PORT_SUCCESS or an error code
void cvmx_mgmt_port_set_max_packet_size ( int  port,
int  size_without_fcs 
)

Set the maximum packet allowed in.

Size is specified including L2 but without FCS. A normal MTU would corespond to 1514 assuming the standard 14 byte L2 header.

Parameters:
port Management port
size_without_fcs Size in bytes without FCS
void cvmx_mgmt_port_set_multicast_list ( int  port,
int  flags 
)

Set the multicast list.

Parameters:
port Management port
flags Interface flags
Returns:
cvmx_mgmt_port_result_t cvmx_mgmt_port_shutdown ( int  port  ) 

Shutdown a management port.

This currently disables packet IO but leaves all hardware and buffers. Another application can then call initialize() without redoing the hardware setup.

Parameters:
port Management port
Returns:
CVMX_MGMT_PORT_SUCCESS or an error code
